image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff in blue suit stand in front of family members at a podium.

props.synopsis: Tasmanians face another few weeks of political uncertainty after the state election delivered another hung parliament. Both the Liberals and Labor will now need to reach out to a progressive crossbench to see if government is possible.

title.children: 'Make it work': Liberals, Labor eye minority government in Tasmania

image.altText: a crowd holding Labor party signs listens to a speech in a red-lit room

props.synopsis: After the election no-one saw coming, what has Tasmania got? A parliament similar to the previous one — and no guarantee it will last.

title.children: Worst result ever for Tasmanian Labor, but they are still in with a shot

image.altText: a man in tan suit smiles into mic while addressing crowd

props.synopsis: Independent Peter George is set to join the Tasmanian parliament after campaigning against salmon farming and the proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium.

title.children: Anti-salmon farm campaigner joins Tasmania's progressive crossbench

image.altText: Two middle aged men in suits

props.synopsis: How long will it take to know the result of the Tasmanian election? A record number of early votes means it could take time before an outcome is clear.

title.children: When will Tasmania have a government?

image.altText: Caucasian man in suit with short hair stands at podium making speech with family behind him, looks optimistic

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party will have the most seats in a hung parliament, while the Labor vote has gone backwards in an early election instigated by its no-confidence motion in the premier.

title.children: Rockliff says voters have 'no confidence' in Labor — as it happened

image.altText: A man stands on a tourist boat that capsized in Ha Long Bay

props.synopsis: The vessel was carrying 48 passengers and five crew members when it capsized on Saturday because of sudden heavy rain.

title.children: Dozens dead after tourist boat capsizes in Ha Long Bay

image.altText: A silver car with a broken tail light crashed into a pole at night.

props.synopsis: A car rams a crowd of people waiting to enter a nightclub along a busy boulevard in Los Angeles, injuring 30 people and leading bystanders to attack the driver, according to authorities.

title.children: Man whose car struck crowd outside Los Angeles club was shot, police say

image.altText: a hand holds a vape with neon coloured pink, purple and orange vapour

props.synopsis: Inside the world of vaping, where influencers, big tobacco and the black market stare down vape reforms and users hunting for a fix.

title.children: How influencers, big tobacco and the black market fight back against vape reforms

image.altText: Detective Superintendent Jason Box looks sideways

props.synopsis: In more than 30 years on the NSW Police force, Detective Superintendent Jason Box has never seen a Sydney gangland war like this one.

title.children: Sydney's gangland war unlike any ever seen by head of taskforce

image.altText: Thymen Arensman holds his arms out in celebration of a stage win

props.synopsis: Dutch rider Thymen Arensman wins the Tour de France's toughest stage, but his Ineos-Grenadiers team is sanctioned after a spectator was hit by one of its cars.

title.children: Tour de France spectator hit by team car as Arensman claims toughest stage

image.altText: A silhouette of a man leans over a fishing pot on a boat, a glowy orange sunset reflects on the ocean behind him

props.synopsis: Four months after a toxic algal bloom was first detected off South Australia's coastlines, business owners on the Yorke Peninsula say they are in dire need of support if they are to survive the ongoing marine disaster.

title.children: Algal bloom impact 'like something you'd see in a horror movie', fisher says

image.altText: Couple looking at windmill

props.synopsis: Long drives for specialist and hospital treatment force older people to consider giving up their homes in regional Australia for better care in cities.

title.children: Stay or go? The tough choice Queenslanders make to live longer

image.altText: An aerial proposal shot of a group of islands on the ocean

props.synopsis: By 2050, cities may float or fly, according to proposals cooked up by billionaires.

title.children: Futuristic cities shaped by billionaires and corporations

image.altText: Billy Joel, wearing a leather jacket and dark sunglasses, scowls at the camera.

props.synopsis: This two-part, five-hour epic is essential viewing for anyone who's ever wanted to know more about one of pop's most guarded stars.

title.children: After 55 years, Billy Joel finally lets his guard down in 5-hour documentary

image.altText: Scottie Scheffler looks upwards after playing a shot at Royal Portrush

props.synopsis: As Scottie Scheffler seemingly romps towards another major title at the Open Championship at Royal Portrush, some magic from local hero Rory McIlroy looms as the American's most-serious challenge.

title.children: 'Inevitable' Scheffler on path to greatness as Open beckons at Royal Portrush

image.altText: Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii tackled by Lions players.

props.synopsis: The Wallabies came up short in the first Test against the Lions in Brisbane, giving coach Joe Schmidt questions he needs to answer before the series moves to Melbourne.

title.children: Lions show Wallabies how far they still have to go to be competitive again

image.altText: Sione Tuipulotu celebrates

props.synopsis: The British and Irish Lions have flexed their considerable muscles to beat the Wallabies 27-19 and take a 1-0 series lead at Brisbane's Lang Park on Saturday night.

title.children: Wallabies fall to defeat in opening Test as Lions power to victory

image.altText: Wide shot showing a suburban garden in Adelaide featuring a colourful array of foliage.

props.synopsis: How do you transform a blank-slate backyard into a plant-filled retreat when you don't have a clear plan or many resources? This Adelaide garden was built around existing fruit trees, using foolproof plants that were easy to propagate.

title.children: This garden was built on a small budget. Here are the key elements

image.altText: Kids toys on the floor.

props.synopsis: The latest disturbing allegations involving workers at Queensland childcare centres have authorities rushing to reassure parents of their commitment to keeping children safe.

title.children: Rush to reassure parents following spate of allegations in childcare

image.altText: A large crowd of people stand in front of the burnt main stage.

props.synopsis: A 35-year-old woman became unwell at the festival and was pronounced dead after being taken to hospital.

title.children: Woman dies after falling ill at Tomorrowland

image.altText: Syrian security force members with rifles stand on a road in the dark as vehicles with headlights on approach them from behind.

props.synopsis: The immediate ceasefire comes after days of bloodshed that left more than 300 people dead.

title.children: Syrian presidency announces ceasefire after fighting in Druze area

image.altText: Two men holding jersey

props.synopsis: Zdravko "Zed" Biliic is remembered at a special game of soccer at Albert Park in Melbourne.

title.children: Friends hold match in honour of slain Sunshine Coast man Zdravko Bilic

image.altText: A blonde woman standing next to a man seated on a stage wearing a cap

props.synopsis: The academic future of dozens of elite performance students is in doubt after Virtual School Victoria tightened its enrolment criteria for 2026.

title.children: 'Enrolment crisis' for performing arts students at virtual school

image.altText: Jess Hull runs on the track during a race

props.synopsis: Olympic silver medallist Jess Hull sets an Oceanian and Australian national mile record while finishing runner-up at the London Diamond League meeting.

title.children: Jess Hull breaks Australian mile record at London Diamond League meet

props.synopsis: Everything you need to know as Tim Tszyu takes on Sebastian Fundora for the WBC super welterweight belt at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas.

title.children: Fundora vs Tszyu II: Everything you need to know

image.altText: Manly and Melbourne players grapple during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: The Storm's showdown with rivals Manly ends in a controversial win for the Sea Eagles as Harry Grant is penalised for contact on Luke Brooks after a field goal attempt.

title.children: 'Barely a touch': Storm fall short after controversial last-minute penalty

image.altText: GettyImages-2225957486

props.synopsis: Steven May will face tribunal scrutiny after leaving Francis Evans bloodied in a contest, as Maurice Rioli lights up Perth with his defensive work.

title.children: 'Intent was to get the ball' Goodwin backs May after sickening clash leaves Blue bloodied

image.altText: Crops growing on a farm on a sunny day in winter

props.synopsis: Rain brings some relief to drought-affected farmers in Victoria, but most of the state is still desperately dry.

title.children: Crops on a 'knife edge' in Victoria as drought continues to bite

image.altText: Stephen Colbert and Jimmy Kimmel, both wearing dark suits, shake hands and smile on the set of a late night show

props.synopsis: Late-night talk show hosts rally around Stephen Colbert following the announcement that his show won't return after 2026, with US President Donald Trump writing on social media: "Kimmel is next."

title.children: 'Kimmel is next': Trump reacts to Colbert cancellation, hosts rally around star

image.altText: Massad Boulos and  Mohammed bin Abdulaziz Al-Khulaifi stand at lecturns in front of a wall of text.

props.synopsis: The signing comes after months of Qatari mediation.

title.children: Congo, M23 rebel group sign declaration of principles to end fighting

image.altText: Two women embrace in a cemetery.

props.synopsis: Funeral photography is about capturing a family's story and emotions while farewelling a loved one.

title.children: Funeral photography allows people to grieve and honour loved ones

image.altText: Two people looking at the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: The siblings who discovered the body of Rosemary Brown 25 years ago have spoken for the first time, as police renew the search for her missing daughter Melissa Trussell.

title.children: Children linked to 25-year cold case speak for the first time

image.altText: Bradley John Murdoch

props.synopsis: Bradley Murdoch spent the rest of his life in prison after being convicted of murdering British backpacker Peter Falconio. Those who knew him behind bars say he was a "lone wolf" and a master manipulator, who was uncooperative until the end.

title.children: Inmates and guards shed light on the real Bradley Murdoch behind bars

image.altText: theatre

props.synopsis: The UK has sanctioned Russian military intelligence officers linked to the 2022 Mariupol theatre bomb attack that killed hundreds of civilians.

title.children: Russian officers sanctioned over bomb attack that killed up to 300

image.altText: Skiers stand next to a sign in the snow.

props.synopsis: Visits to Aussie ski resorts dropped by nearly 30 per cent since the pandemic with the expense putting it out of reach for many. But here's some tips on how to do it without breaking the bank.

title.children: Is skiing overseas really cheaper? The Japan vs Aussie alps showdown
